page.title: 05Education in Chalton
page.content:
A group visited the old{Board School. The new owners have lots of furniture stored in the 5m. high schoolroom. From documents, it was discovered that {children started school at 3 years old {and ended at about 13 years old.}They} did not have history, music or science and the only maths they had was arithmetic. Excuses for absence included snow, helping at harvest, and shooting parties or helping at home. {The average attendance in 1885 was 75.
Today,Chalton children go to playgroups at Rowlands Castle and to First School at Clanfield or Blendworth. After attending Middle School at Clanfield they go to Horndean Comprehensive. The Children travel by taxi. Two children attend a private school at Compton.
